list_definition.definition: clever and quick in thought and action

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: We need a smart boy to help in the shop
I don’t trust some of those smart salesmen.
She gave him a smart slap on the cheek.

list_definition.definition: (of part of the body) to be affected by a sharp stinging feeling

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: The thick smoke made his eyes smart.

list_definition.definition: to feel annoyed, resentful etc after being insulted etc

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: He is still smarting from your remarks.

list_definition.mean_english: sự đau đớn, sự nhức nhối
list_definition.definition: the stinging feeling left by a blow or the resentful feeling left by an insult

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: He could still feel the smart of her slap/insult.

list_ex_of_english: Of these, households with the largest living quarters and the smartest interior are preferred.
They will have to work with these people, and they do not want to have new staffs smarting under a sense of injustice from the start.
Smarting with disappointment, they will be prepared to spend money out of anyone's pocket when they are trying to make the best title they can make.
There have been many complaints, particularly about smarting eyes and running noses caused by sulphuric acid spray from the cooling system.
They volunteered without loss of time, but they are now smarting because of the delay—the un- necessary delay which is taking place in the payment of their gratuities.
Along with the move to the new building, the school initiated a smarter uniform to help improve the ethos of the school.
He despises bugs and someone who is smarter than him.
I may still be smarting from international women's day, which was yesterday, but it is equally important to ensure that men are able to take an equal place in society.
